Posts.Content: As everyone else who responded here tanning booths are not advisable.  In 2000 I had malignant melanoma level 5 severely on my back and had a large surgery with reconstruction.  Then another operation come 6 months to move the blood vessels in a better place.  My 3 oncologist, for I went for all of their opinions, said they believed it was from the tanning booths I use to visit.  I wish I had another alternative for you but I don't-sorry. JaeAnn
Posts.Title: Tanning

Posts.Content: Hello everyone, I have a question for you all that.  One month after surgery on my breast to remove the big C I've now developed a new problem.  I have pain. My Radiation/Oncologist stated that this is fluid build up and I may need an aspiration.  Has anyone else had this problem?  I'm wondering why this would cause such pain.  Is it because I was sewed to tight, etc.  I'm curious on how many of us need an aspiration post surgery.  Is this on the rise or is this a rare problem...
Posts.Title: New Pain
